summary:
Hypertension is a serious medical condition where your blood pressure is consistently high. It often doesn't show symptoms but can lead to major health problems like strokes, heart disease, and kidney issues. There are two types: primary (lifestyle-related) and secondary (caused by other health issues).

High blood pressure is usually over 130/80 mmHg. You can control it through lifestyle changes like exercising, eating healthily, and reducing salt and alcohol. Sometimes, doctors prescribe medications to help lower blood pressure and reduce health risks. It's important to monitor and manage hypertension to prevent complications.
title: Hypertension
